newsitem.title: USA: U.S. cotton weekly export sales highlights -- USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. cotton weekly export sales highlights -- USDA.

text.p: USDA cotton export sales highlights in latest reporting week:
Net Upland sales of 93,800 running bales (RB) were 47 percent above the previous week, but 41 percent below the 4-week average.

Major increases were reported for China (25,400 RB), South Korea (13,100 RB), Hong Kong (11,200 RB), and Indonesia (9,400 RB). Sales of 89,900 RB for delivery in the 1997/98 marketing year were mainly for Canada (46,500 RB) and Japan (28,100 RB).

Exports of 193,000 RB--a marketing-year high--were one-tenth above the previous week and 28 percent above the 4-week average. Asian destinations accounted for 72 percent of the week's shipments; Western Hemisphere, 21 percent; and West European, 7 percent.
